item.title: Peer Discovery over UDP
item.author: taylor@teukka.tech (taylor thompson)
item.description: What is Peer discovery Peer discovery allows you to discover other computers on the same subnet, intranet, or through the internet. Discovering peers directly removes the necessity of a centralized server architecture, reducing the number of network jumps your packets require to share information with each other. Peer discovery can be used in: discovering microservices in the same docker network or kubernetes cluster, file sharing (like airdrop and bittorrent), and peer to peer gaming.
